alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 11:19AM EST until further notice by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Michigan... River Raisin At Monroe City affecting Monroe County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...River Raisin At Monroe City. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Some minor overflow begins. At 9.0 feet, Flooding begins at the Monroe YMCA. At 9.5 feet, Several homes flood on the western edge of Monroe. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:40 AM EST Friday the stage was 10.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:40 AM EST Friday was 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river level is expected to fluctuate between 9.5 feet and 10.5 feet due to variable ice cover and ice restricted flow along the river. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.3 feet on 01/15/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
